Tests¶

Module implements some tests (namely, for operations, conversions, and expressions).

Testing conversions¶

A base 10 number is generated at random. Afterwards, it is converted successively a number of times, into random bases. In the end, the number is converted back into base 10.

If the initial value is equal to the final value, then there is an extremely high chance that all conversions were performed correctly.

Testing expressions¶

There are some hard-coded expressions that are tested. In addition, the application runs the tests from http://infoarena.ro/problema/evaluare (similar problem, large input files, only base 10).

Testing operations¶

Two random base 10 numbers are generated. Both of them are converted to the same arbitrary base, and all possible operators are applied on them. The results are compared to the correct values, which are obtained by applying the corresponding built-in Python operators, and converted using the numpy collection.

class tests.test.Test[source]¶
__weakref__¶

list of weak references to the object (if defined)

testConversions(testCount=10, sizemax=5, verbose=False)[source]¶

Method tests the conversion method, using the following mechanism:

  1. Take a random number in base 10.
  2. Convert it a number of times (say, 100) into random bases.
  3. Convert it back into base 10.

If all conversions are correct, then the result should match the initial value.

Raises:
AssertionError:if some test fails.
testExpressions(verbose=False)[source]¶

Some tests are taken from infoarena: http://www.infoarena.ro/problema/evaluare

testOperations(testCount=10, sizemax=5, verbose=False)[source]¶

Method tests the following operators: +, -, *, //, %, **, abs().

Raises:
AssertionError:if some test fails.
